title: Part A Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Calls getLapTime for at least one of carOne or carTwo

Canonical Solution: 

public String findWinner(int numLaps)
{
   double car1Time = 0;
   double car2Time = 0;
   for(int j = 1; j <= numLaps; j++)   
   {
      car1Time += carOne.getLapTime(j);
      car2Time += carTwo.getLapTime(j);
   }
   if (car1Time < car2Time)
   {
      return "Car 1 Wins!";
   }
   else if(car2Time < car1Time)
   {
      return "Car 2 Wins!";
   }
   else
   {
      return "Tie!";
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • make any incorrect call to getLapTime

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • make any incorrect call to getLapTime

title: Part A Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Loops numLaps times

Canonical Solution: 

public String findWinner(int numLaps)
{
   double car1Time = 0;
   double car2Time = 0;
   for(int j = 1; j <= numLaps; j++)   
   {
      car1Time += carOne.getLapTime(j);
      car2Time += carTwo.getLapTime(j);
   }
   if (car1Time < car2Time)
   {
      return "Car 1 Wins!";
   }
   else if(car2Time < car1Time)
   {
      return "Car 2 Wins!";
   }
   else
   {
      return "Tie!";
   }
}
descriptions: The response does not earn the point.
The response earns the point.

title: Part A Point 3
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Calculates the total amount of time for at least one race car

Canonical Solution:

public String findWinner(int numLaps)
{
   double car1Time = 0;
   double car2Time = 0;
   for(int j = 1; j <= numLaps; j++)   
   {
      car1Time += carOne.getLapTime(j);
      car2Time += carTwo.getLapTime(j);
   }
   if (car1Time < car2Time)
   {
      return "Car 1 Wins!";
   }
   else if(car2Time < car1Time)
   {
      return "Car 2 Wins!";
   }
   else
   {
      return "Tie!";
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to use the total

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to initialize a variable for the total
  • accumulate times for both cars into the same variable

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to use the total

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to initialize a variable for the total
  • accumulate times for both cars into the same variable

title: Part A Point 4
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Returns a correct string based on the calculated total time for each race car (algorithm)

Canonical Solution: 

public String findWinner(int numLaps)
{
   double car1Time = 0;
   double car2Time = 0;
   for(int j = 1; j <= numLaps; j++)   
   {
      car1Time += carOne.getLapTime(j);
      car2Time += carTwo.getLapTime(j);
   }
   if (car1Time < car2Time)
   {
      return "Car 1 Wins!";
   }
   else if(car2Time < car1Time)
   {
      return "Car 2 Wins!";
   }
   else
   {
      return "Tie!";
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to compare lap times
  • fail to return the string
  • print the string instead of or in addition to returning it

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to compare lap times
  • fail to return the string
  • print the string instead of or in addition to returning it
